message.content:
cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.MM. 

The paper deals with the problem of instance segmentation, which is a subfield of computer vision (cs.CV). The paper also proposes a new method for amodal instance segmentation, which involves predicting the region encompassing both visible and occluded parts of each object. This problem is closely related to the fields of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG), as the proposed method relies on training a model using standard modal instance segmentation annotations. Additionally, the problem of instance segmentation is relevant to robotics (cs.RO), as robots need to be able to perceive and interact with objects in their environment. Finally, the paper includes qualitative and quantitative evaluations of the proposed method, which suggests that it may also be relevant to multimedia (cs.MM) research.
